etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in John Balfour (1808–1884), botanist. From rhizo- + -carp, after either scientific Latin Rhizocarpae or German Rhizokarp

definitions: Any plant of the (former) class Rhizocarpeae (now the family Marsileaceae) of aquatic and semiaquatic ferns; a marsileaceous plant.
